Multi-Factor Authentication

Multiple authentication options enhance identity verification and protect the security of your data and apps.

Apply for a trial Buy now

Increased security for data and apps

  • Protect access using mobile apps, phone calls and text messages
  • Deploy in the cloud
  • Keep hybrid environments consistent with local environments
  • Reduce risk and fulfil compliance requirements

Greater security, fewer obstacles

Azure Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) protects access to your data and apps, while also meeting user demand for simple logon processes. MFA uses a range of simple authentication options, including phone call, text and mobile app notifications, to provide identity verification, so users can use their preferred method.

Deploy in the cloud

Enable MFA in Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) to add extra authentication measures for all cloud-based apps and services.

Provides more protection for Azure administrators

Azure MFA provides additional layers of security for Azure administrator accounts for free. If you enable MFA, you will need to confirm your identity before you can run VMs, manage storage or use other Azure services.
